name: Christian Ikenmeyer
content: Christian Ikenmeyer Christian Ikenmeyer firstname dot lastname at warwick.ac.uk Workshop and online lecture series With Jakob Moosbauer I organize a workshop on Algebraic Complexity, Geometry, and Representations, 2025-March-17 to 21. With Pranjal Dutta and Vladimir Lysikov I organized the Algebraic Complexity Theory Workshop at ICALP 2023. I was the main organizer of the Seventh Workshop on Algebraic Complexity Theory (WACT), 2023. I was a co-organizer of the 2021 lecture series on geometric complexity theory. With Mateusz Michałek (formerly MPI-MiS Leipzig) I organized the MPI-INF and MPI-MiS joint workshop on Theoretical Computer Science and Algebraic Geometry that was held in Saarbrücken from January 14 - 18, 2019. Lecture notes Lecture notes on Geometric Complexity Theory, with Markus Bläser Teaching Geometric Complexity Theory in Saarbrücken Summer semester 2018: A first introduction to geometric complexity theory Winter semester 2017/2018: Geometric complexity theory 2 (with Markus Bläser) Summer semester 2017: Introduction to geometric complexity theory (with Markus Bläser) Research Interests Computational complexity theory (algebraic, geometric, Boolean) Tensor rank Computational representation theory Algebraic combinatorics Algebraic geometry CV and Publications CV and publication list PhD thesis (2012) Diplomarbeit (2008) Software Paper 'Young Flattenings in the Schur module basis' (with Lennart Haas) with source code: [ arXiv ] Source code for the paper 'Equations for GL-invariant families of polynomials': [ GL-paper ] A Java implementation of algorithms for computing Littlewood-Richardson coefficients: [ source ] The corresponding papers are 'Deciding Positivity of Littlewood-Richardson coefficients' (with Peter Bürgisser) and 'Small Littlewood-Richardson coefficients'.
